alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 10 at 5:11PM MDT until May 10 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 510 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was expanding north from Roosevelt through Curry County toward southern Quay County. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 351 and 397. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Melrose, Elida, Dora, Floyd, Grady, Causey and Ragland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
